posts.post_content:
Looking for a joe jackson card...

I know it's a long shot but maybe a Cracker Jack in poor condition (beater)
Or maybe a strip card.

I just want to see what's out there.

pm me.

Thank you

I've gotten a little more educated now....
Looking for a 1919 JJ strip card.. 

Pm if you have one.

Thanks!

I just had a strip card on eBay and lost in the last seconds....

If anyone has one of a CJ "beater" I'm all ears!

Thanks
A beater CJ Joe Jax will cost a boatload more than a strip card

[quote name="Joshwesley" post=1443786]No doubt about it.
Thanks![/QUOTE]

If you're looking for a cheap Jackson, I like a nice B18 blanket.  Artwork is comparable to a strip, you'll save a little money and it's a nice representation.

[quote name="bbcard1" post=1443850]If you're looking for a cheap Jackson, I like a nice B18 blanket.  Artwork is comparable to a strip, you'll save a little money and it's a nice representation.[/QUOTE]

Thanks for your suggestion.
  A real nice board member sent one my way.... And while it's certainly neat, I'm looking for a graded/card... 

My search continues! 
Thanks!
Not sure what your budget is, but I have an E90-1 SGC 20 Jax rookie available.  Card has great eye appeal, however, so that will be factored into the price.

May also consider a game card.  Polo grounds or Tom Baker game.  Can be had graded for a lot less than the main issues of cards.  That is how i got my first Jackson, and then added a M101-4 Sporting news later.  Good luck.

For me, it's a Cracker Jack, W-strip card of bust!

I'm just going to have to take my time and find the right one (which is completely the opposite of what I always do)

Thanks to everyone!
Would you consider a T202 Tannehill & Lord with Joe Jackson sliding into third base in the center panel? I can make that happen with a decent looking SGC 45.

I got the W-Strip card!!
Thanks...

Finally have a real joe jackson!!!
